title: Stephen Wozniak joins HP
Wozniak proposes that HP create a personal computer. He is rejected
March - Steve Wozniak and Steve Jobs finish work on a computer circuit board, that they call the Apple I computer
April - Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak form the Apple Computer Company, on April Fool's Day
July - The Apple I computer board is sold in kit form, and delivered to stores by Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak
August - Steve Wozniak begins work on the Apple II
October - Wozniak remains at HP, but is soon convinced that he should leave and join Apple Computer
December - Steve Wozniak and Randy Wigginton demonstrate the first prototype Apple II at a Homebrew Computer Club meeting
March - Apple Computer moves from Jobs' garage to an office in Cupertino
April - Apple Computer delivers its first Apple II system, for $1295
May - 10 months after its introduction, 175 Apple I kits have sold
Apple Computer begins work on an enhanced Apple II with custom chips, code-named Annie
Apple Computer begins work on a supercomputer with a bitsliced architecture, code-named Lisa
June - Apple Computer introduces the Apple II Plus, with 48KB memory, for US$1195
September - Apple Computer sells 35,000 Apple II computers for the fiscal year
October - 2.5 years after the introduction of the Apple II, 50,000 units have been sold
Apple Computer begins work on "Sara", the code name for what will be the Apple III

note: Price ranges from US$4500 to US$8000.
title: May - Apple Computer introduces the Apple III
September - Apple Computer sells over 78,000 Apple II computers during the fiscal year
Apple Computer ships the first Apple III units in limited quantity
Apple Computer begins project "Diana", which would become the Apple IIe
September - Apple Computer introduces its first hard drive, the 5MB ProFile, for US$3499
Apple Computer officially reintroduces the Apple III, with improved software and a hard disk
Sales of Apple II Plus to date: 45,000. Apple ][ Computer Technical Information http://www.oldcomputers.net/index.html _________________ Apple II Computer Information _________________
Sales of all Apple II systems to date
Apple Computer becomes the first personal computer company to reach US$1 billion in annual sales
Franklin Computer Corp. unveils the Franklin Ace 1000, the first legal (at the time) Apple II clone
January - Apple Computer officially unveils the Lisa computer. Its initial price is US$10,000
January - Apple Computer introduces the Apple IIe for US$1400
June - The one millionth Apple II is made
June - Apple Computer begins shipping the Lisa
June - Video Technology introduces the Laser 3000, an Apple II workalike microcomputer
June - Unitronics shows the Sonic, an Apple II workalike microcomputer
July - Apple Computer officially begins marketing the Lisa computer
December - Apple Computer introduces the redesigned Apple III as the Apple III+, for US$3000
December - Apple unveils the new Macintosh to the press
Franklin shows an operating Franklin Ace 1200 Apple II compatible for US$2200

note: It uses all new software, as well as the Macintosh operating system.
title: January - Apple releases a new version of the Lisa computer, the Lisa 2
January - Apple Computer's Steve Jobs introduces the Apple Macintosh
April - Apple Computer unveils the Apple IIc
April - Apple Computer retires the Apple III and Apple III+, with only 65,000 units sold in total (90,000 made
May - Apple Computer announces that 70,000 Macintosh computers have been shipped in the first 100 days since its announcement
September - Apple Computer introduces the Macintosh 512K for US$3200
November - The 2 millionth Apple II computer is sold
Apple sells the 250,000th Macintosh system
January - Apple Computer officially renames the Lisa the Macintosh XL
March - Apple Computer introduces the Apple Enhanced IIe

note: formerly called Lisa) is dropped from Apple Computer's product line.
title: April - The Macintosh XL
January - Apple Computer introduces the Macintosh Plus
April - Apple Computer discontinues the original Macintosh and the Macintosh 512K
_________________ Apple II Computer Information _________________
April - Apple Computer introduces the Macintosh 512K Enhanced, for US$2000
July - Apple Computer discontinues the Macintosh XL
September - Apple Computer introduces the Apple IIGS, with the Apple 3.5 drive, for US$1000
January - Apple Computer introduces the Apple Platinum IIe
March - Apple Computer introduces the open architecture Macintosh II, US$3900
March - Apple Computer makes its 1 millionth Macintosh personal computer
March - Apple Computer introduces the expandable Macintosh SE for US$2900
March - Apple Computer discontinues the Macintosh 512K Enhanced
Apple Computer begins shipping the Macintosh II
September - Apple Computer introduces the Apple IIc Plus for US$1100
September - Apple Computer introduces the Macintosh IIx computer, base price is US$7770
January - Apple Computer introduces the Macintosh SE/30
September - Apple Computer announces the Macintosh Portable, for US$6500
September - Apple Computer announces the Macintosh IIci, for about US$8700. Apple ][ Computer Technical Information
